title: Is there any way that a human body could produce ultrasonic sound? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes. Sounds above 20,000 Hertz (the generally recognized limit of human hearing) are considered ultrasonic. The Guinness World Record for greatest female range[1] includes the note G10, which is 10 octaves above the G above middle C. This comes to 25,088 Hertz and qualifies as ultrasonic. The record for the highest note whistled[2] is 4,277 Hz which isn't even close to ultrasonic. Footnotes[1] Greatest vocal range, female[2] Highest note whistled
